1.text: After this, Job opened his mouth and cursed his day.

3.text: Let the day perish in which I was born, and the night that said, There is a man child conceived.

4.text: That day—let it be darkness, let not +God care for it from above, neither let light shine upon it:

5.text: Let darkness and the shadow of death claim it; let clouds dwell upon it; let darkeners of the day terrify it.

6.text: That night—let gloom seize upon it; let it not rejoice among the days of the year; let it not come into the number of the months.

7.text: Behold, let that night be barren; let no joyful sound come therein;

8.text: Let them curse it that curse the day, who are ready to rouse Leviathan;

9.text: Let the stars of its twilight be dark; let it wait for light, and have none, neither let it see the eyelids of the dawn:

10.text: Because it shut not up the doors of the womb that bore me, and hid not trouble from mine eyes.

11.text: Wherefore did I not die from the womb,—come forth from the belly and expire?

12.text: Why did the knees meet me? and wherefore the breasts, that I should suck?

13.text: For now should I have lain down and been quiet; I should have slept: then had I been at rest,

14.text: With kings and counsellors of the earth, who build desolate places for themselves,

15.text: Or with princes who had gold, who filled their houses with silver;

16.text: Or as a hidden untimely birth I had not been; as infants that have not seen the light.

17.text: There the wicked cease from troubling; and there the wearied are at rest.

18.text: The prisoners together are at ease; they hear not the voice of the taskmaster.

19.text: The small and great are there, and the bondman freed from his master.

20.text: Wherefore is light given to him that is in trouble, and life to those bitter of soul,

21.text: Who long for death, and it [cometh] not, and dig for it more than for hidden treasures;

22.text: Who rejoice even exultingly and are glad when they find the grave?—

23.text: To the man whose way is hidden, and whom +God hath hedged in?

24.text: For my sighing cometh before my bread, and my groanings are poured out like the waters.

25.text: For I feared a fear, and it hath come upon me, and that which I dreaded hath come to me.

26.text: I was not in safety, neither had I quietness, neither was I at rest, and trouble came.
